text: Pete have you ever wondered disguise I'm
wearing one right now without any
question my most effective disguise was
Betty the bag
nobody thinks that you're going to like
dress up like a fat old lady I deployed
a disguise for every visit to one
restaurant because the restaurateur had
publicly stated that if he caught me in
his restaurant he would or he would
throw me out and in fact the employee
who spotted me would get a free trip to
the Caribbean it's extraordinary what
you can do with just the very little
alteration of hairline glasses very
minor adjustments that can make you
invisible even to people who know you
very well bald white guy in New York
City known for wearing button-down
shirts and a tie change to a black dress
shirt put on a you know a chain or
something and instantly you couldn't
possibly be that guy when you make
reservations do you use fake names how
does that work I sometimes would make up
the name by looking at my bookshelf and
so I dined out as mr. Strunk mr. white
mr. Webster mr. foder mr. Frommer
there's a lot of pressure with those
names you don't want them to be too
complicated because they're frankly too
easy to forget so forgettable that
unfortunately I myself forgot the name
when I went to one of my early
assignments that's a problem when they
ask you under what name the reservation
is I don't know I'm not sure it's
impossible to know how often you're
recognized suddenly a lot of people are
filling up your water glass in your wine
glass if you have to go out and go to
the men's room you're virtually carried
there on the shoulders of two or three
waiters it's really sort of a joke and
often counterproductive I mean that's
not good service and I had to kept
changing my credit-card names there's a
real restaurant grapevine where chefs
and restaurateurs share inside
information they've learned about
critics they would call each other
around and tell each other the names the
what you know what color wigs I was
wearing and they can't after recognizing
you run to the run to their suppliers
and get better stuff they can't change
the rest
these they're using they can't swap in
and out kitchen talent the DNA of that
restaurant is what the DNA of that
restaurant is and recognizing you can't
change that we see the top of your head
meat that's my nose you're not
cooperating I'm sorry this is this is
the life we've chosen
